interestingcomments.content:
Dead pixel or dust? /!/ Hey,

Is a dead pixel always visible or does it depend on the aperture like dust spots. I have one spot which is only visible if I take a photo of a bright surface with a small aperture and I'm not sure if it's dust or a dead pixel.
interestingcomments.MarkedSent:
Dead pixel or dust? /!/ Hey,

Is a dead pixel always visible or does it depend on the aperture like dust spots. I have one spot which is only visible if I take a photo of a bright surface with a small aperture and I'm not sure if it's dust or a dead pixel.

interestingcomments.content:
Sensor cleaning -- the scourge of digital photography (rant) /!/ Anyone else who also flys into rage just thinking about having to clean the sensor?

I got me a cleaning kit with swabs and some liquid, a bellows to blow the dust away, a feature for the camera to vibrate the sensor for shaking of dust, but every way I do it, the specks of dust are just arranged differently on the sensor. I properly clean it (at least that's what I think of doing), shine on it with a torch, everything looks nice and shiny, yet the test photo shows another set of blemishes.

I'm so fed up with this shit, you cannot beleave it.
